Package net.minestom.server.command.builder.arguments

Class ArgumentWord

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minestom.server.command.builder.arguments.Argument<java.lang.String>
      • net.minestom.server.command.builder.arguments.ArgumentWord
  • public class ArgumentWord
extends Argument<java.lang.String>
    Represents a single word in the command.

    You can specify the valid words with from(String...) (do not abuse it or the client will not be able to join).

    Example: hey

    • Method Detail

      • from

        @NotNull
public ArgumentWord from​(@Nullable
                         java.lang.String... restrictions)
        Used to force the use of a few precise words instead of complete freedom.

        WARNING: having an array too long would result in a packet too big or the client being stuck during login.

        Parameters:
        restrictions - the accepted words, can be null but if an array is passed you need to ensure that it is filled with non-null values
        Returns:
        'this' for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if restrictions is not null but contains null value(s)

      • parse

public java.lang.String parse​(@NotNull

                       throws ArgumentSyntaxException
        Description copied from class: Argument
        Parses the given input, and throw an ArgumentSyntaxException if the input cannot be convert to T

        input - the argument to parse
        Returns:
        the parsed argument

      • processNodes

        public void processNodes​(@NotNull
                         NodeMaker nodeMaker,
                         boolean executable)
        Description copied from class: Argument
        Turns the argument into a list of nodes for command dispatching. Make sure to set the Node's parser.
        Specified by:
        processNodes in class Argument<java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        nodeMaker - helper object used to create and modify nodes
        executable - true if this will be the last argument, false otherwise

      • hasRestrictions

        public boolean hasRestrictions()
        Gets if this argument allow complete freedom in the word choice or if a list has been defined.
        Returns:
        true if the word selection is restricted

      • getRestrictions

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String[] getRestrictions()
        Gets all the word restrictions.
        Returns:
        the word restrictions, can be null
